alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:51AM EDT until July 28 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Dearborn County in southeastern Indiana... Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Northeastern Ripley County in southeastern Indiana... * Until 600 AM EDT. * At 251 AM EDT, radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Batesville, Brookville, Bright, Oldenburg, Logan, Sunman, Metamora, St. Leon, Cedar Grove, Saint Peter, Lawrenceville, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Penntown, Peppertown, New Alsace, Mounds State Recreation Area, Dover, New Trenton, Hamburg and Interstate 74 at US Route 52. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
